data.question: What is the full name of PCN-222?
What is the role of metalloporphyrins in nature?
data.answer: Metalloporphyrins perform many biological functions such as light harvesting, oxygen transportation, and catalysis.

data.question: Why is direct application of heme as an oxidation catalyst in aqueous solution usually challenging?
data.answer: Because it leads to the formation of catalytically inactive dimers and catalyst self-destruction in the oxidizing reaction media.

data.question: What unique strategy is proposed for assembling highly stable porous materials?
data.answer: Employing heme-like active centers as structural motifs.

data.question: What are the desirable features of MOFs?
data.answer: Permanent porosity, high surface area, and uniform open cavities.

data.question: What is the diameter of the largest known 1D open channels in PCN-222(Fe)?
How does the stability of PCN-222(Fe) compare to other MOFs when exposed to concentrated hydrochloric acid?
data.answer: PCN-222(Fe) shows exceptional stability, even in concentrated hydrochloric acid, which is rarely observed with other MOF materials.

data.question: What is the significance of the Zr6 cluster in the stability of PCN-222?
data.answer: The Zr6 cluster is one of the most stable building units for MOF construction, contributing to the exceptional stability of PCN-222.

data.question: Why does PCN-222(Fe) exhibit excellent catalytic performance?
data.answer: Due to the high density of the porphyrin active centers in PCN-222(Fe), which provides one active site per 1286 Da.

data.question: What is the role of large open channels in PCN-222(Fe)?
data.answer: They facilitate the diffusion of substrates to the catalytic sites.

Does PCN-222(Fe) have a lower Km value than the natural horseradish peroxidase (HRP) enzyme for the pyrogallol oxidation reaction?
Are all MOFs with porphyrin centers equally effective in catalysis as PCN-222(Fe)?
Does PCN-222(Fe) maintain its structure and function after exposure to boiling water?
Is the synthesis of PCN-222(Fe) carried out at room temperature?
Do the mesopores in PCN-222(Fe) contribute to its high catalytic activity?
Is the BET surface area of PCN-222(Fe) less than 2000 m2 g-1?
What is the yield of the synthesis process for PCN-222(Fe)?
What is the role of benzoic acid in the synthesis of PCN-222?
data.answer: It is used in the solvothermal reaction mixture.
